name: licentiousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour that is sexual, in a way that is uncontrolled and socially unacceptable: When it first came out, the novel was banned for licentiousness. Charles's reign ushered in a period of licentiousness. See
licentious
More examplesFewer examplesThey hit back against what they saw as the growing licentiousness and depravity of the movie industry. Seeing how much we know about Roman licentiousness, it is not surprising that a great deal of erotic material was found in Pompeii.All manner of licentiousness went on in that house.
